name: initialize_project
description: Initializes a new Task Master project structure by calling the core initialization logic. Creates necessary folders and configuration files for Task Master in the current directory.

skipInstall.description: Skip installing dependencies automatically. Never do this unless you are sure the project is already installed.

addAliases.description: Add shell aliases (tm, taskmaster) to shell config file.

initGit.description: Initialize Git repository in project root.

storeTasksInGit.description: Store tasks in Git (tasks.json and tasks/ directory).

yes.description: Skip prompts and use default values. Always set to true for MCP tools.

projectRoot.description: The root directory for the project. ALWAYS SET THIS TO THE PROJECT ROOT DIRECTORY. IF NOT SET, THE TOOL WILL NOT WORK.

rules.description: List of rule profiles to include at initialization. If omitted, defaults to Cursor profile only. Available options: amp, claude, cline, codex, cursor, gemini, kiro, opencode, kilo, roo, trae, vscode, windsurf, zed

name: models
description: Get information about available AI models or set model configurations. Run without arguments to get the current model configuration and API key status for the selected model providers.

setMain.description: Set the primary model for task generation/updates. Model provider API key is required in the MCP config ENV.

setResearch.description: Set the model for research-backed operations. Model provider API key is required in the MCP config ENV.

setFallback.description: Set the model to use if the primary fails. Model provider API key is required in the MCP config ENV.

listAvailableModels.description: List all available models not currently in use. Input/output costs values are in dollars (3 is $3.00).

projectRoot.description: The directory of the project. Must be an absolute path.

openrouter.description: Indicates the set model ID is a custom OpenRouter model.

ollama.description: Indicates the set model ID is a custom Ollama model.

bedrock.description: Indicates the set model ID is a custom AWS Bedrock model.

azure.description: Indicates the set model ID is a custom Azure OpenAI model.

vertex.description: Indicates the set model ID is a custom Google Vertex AI model.

name: rules
description: Add or remove rule profiles from the project.

action.description: Whether to add or remove rule profiles.

profiles.description: List of rule profiles to add or remove (e.g., ["cursor", "roo"]). Available options: amp, claude, cline, codex, cursor, gemini, kiro, opencode, kilo, roo, trae, vscode, windsurf, zed

projectRoot.description: The root directory of the project. Must be an absolute path.

force.description: DANGEROUS: Force removal even if it would leave no rule profiles. Only use if you are absolutely certain.

name: parse_prd
description: Parse a Product Requirements Document (PRD) text file to automatically generate initial tasks. Reinitializing the project is not necessary to run this tool. It is recommended to run parse-prd after initializing the project and creating/importing a prd.txt file in the project root's .taskmaster/docs directory.

input.description: Absolute path to the PRD document file (.txt, .md, etc.)

projectRoot.description: The directory of the project. Must be an absolute path.

numTasks.description: Approximate number of top-level tasks to generate (default: 10). As the agent, if you have enough information, ensure to enter a number of tasks that would logically scale with project complexity. Setting to 0 will allow Taskmaster to determine the appropriate number of tasks based on the complexity of the PRD. Avoid entering numbers above 50 due to context window limitations.

force.description: Overwrite existing output file without prompting.

research.description: Enable Taskmaster to use the research role for potentially more informed task generation. Requires appropriate API key.

append.description: Append generated tasks to existing file.

name: analyze_project_complexity
description: Analyze task complexity and generate expansion recommendations.

threshold.description: Complexity score threshold (1-10) to recommend expansion.

research.description: Use Perplexity AI for research-backed analysis.

output.description: Output file path relative to project root (default: .taskmaster/reports/task-complexity-report.json).

file.description: Path to the tasks file relative to project root (default: tasks/tasks.json).

ids.description: Comma-separated list of task IDs to analyze specifically (e.g., "1,3,5").

from.description: Starting task ID in a range to analyze.

to.description: Ending task ID in a range to analyze.

projectRoot.description: The directory of the project. Must be an absolute path.

name: expand_task
description: Expand a task into subtasks for detailed implementation

file.description: Path to the tasks file relative to project root (e.g., tasks/tasks.json)

projectRoot.description: The directory of the project. Must be an absolute path.

force.description: Force expansion even if subtasks exist

name: expand_all
description: Expand all pending tasks into subtasks based on complexity or defaults

num.description: Target number of subtasks per task (uses complexity/defaults otherwise)

research.description: Enable research-backed subtask generation (e.g., using Perplexity)

prompt.description: Additional context to guide subtask generation for all tasks

force.description: Force regeneration of subtasks for tasks that already have them

file.description: Absolute path to the tasks file in the /tasks folder inside the project root (default: tasks/tasks.json)

projectRoot.description: Absolute path to the project root directory (derived from session if possible)

name: scope_up_task
description: Increase the complexity of one or more tasks using AI

id.description: Comma-separated list of task IDs to scope up (e.g., "1,3,5")

strength.description: Strength level: light, regular, or heavy (default: regular)

prompt.description: Custom prompt for specific scoping adjustments

file.description: Path to the tasks file (default: tasks/tasks.json)

projectRoot.description: The directory of the project. Must be an absolute path.

research.description: Whether to use research capabilities for scoping

name: scope_down_task
description: Decrease the complexity of one or more tasks using AI

id.description: Comma-separated list of task IDs to scope down (e.g., "1,3,5")

strength.description: Strength level: light, regular, or heavy (default: regular)

prompt.description: Custom prompt for specific scoping adjustments

file.description: Path to the tasks file (default: tasks/tasks.json)

projectRoot.description: The directory of the project. Must be an absolute path.

research.description: Whether to use research capabilities for scoping

name: get_tasks
description: Get all tasks from Task Master, optionally filtering by status and including subtasks.

status.description: Filter tasks by status (e.g., 'pending', 'done') or multiple statuses separated by commas (e.g., 'blocked,deferred')

withSubtasks.description: Include subtasks nested within their parent tasks in the response

file.description: Path to the tasks file (relative to project root or absolute)

complexityReport.description: Path to the complexity report file (relative to project root or absolute)

projectRoot.description: The directory of the project. Must be an absolute path.

name: get_task
description: Get detailed information about a specific task

id.description: Task ID(s) to get (can be comma-separated for multiple tasks)

file.description: Path to the tasks file relative to project root

complexityReport.description: Path to the complexity report file (relative to project root or absolute)

projectRoot.description: Absolute path to the project root directory (Optional, usually from session)

name: next_task
description: Find the next task to work on based on dependencies and status

file.description: Absolute path to the tasks file

complexityReport.description: Path to the complexity report file (relative to project root or absolute)

projectRoot.description: The directory of the project. Must be an absolute path.

name: complexity_report
description: Display the complexity analysis report in a readable format

file.description: Path to the report file (default: .taskmaster/reports/task-complexity-report.json)

projectRoot.description: The directory of the project. Must be an absolute path.

name: set_task_status
description: Set the status of one or more tasks or subtasks.

id.description: Task ID or subtask ID (e.g., '15', '15.2'). Can be comma-separated to update multiple tasks/subtasks at once.

file.description: Absolute path to the tasks file

complexityReport.description: Path to the complexity report file (relative to project root or absolute)

projectRoot.description: The directory of the project. Must be an absolute path.

tag.description: Optional tag context to operate on

name: generate
description: Generates individual task files in tasks/ directory based on tasks.json

file.description: Absolute path to the tasks file

output.description: Output directory (default: same directory as tasks file)

projectRoot.description: The directory of the project. Must be an absolute path.

name: add_task
description: Add a new task using AI

prompt.description: Description of the task to add (required if not using manual fields)

dependencies.description: Comma-separated list of task IDs this task depends on

file.description: Path to the tasks file (default: tasks/tasks.json)

projectRoot.description: The directory of the project. Must be an absolute path.

research.description: Whether to use research capabilities for task creation

name: add_subtask
description: Add a subtask to an existing task

taskId.description: Existing task ID to convert to subtask

title.description: Title for the new subtask (when creating a new subtask)

details.description: Implementation details for the new subtask

dependencies.description: Comma-separated list of dependency IDs for the new subtask

file.description: Absolute path to the tasks file (default: tasks/tasks.json)

projectRoot.description: The directory of the project. Must be an absolute path.

name: update
description: Update multiple upcoming tasks (with ID >= 'from' ID) based on new context or changes provided in the prompt. Use 'update_task' instead for a single specific task or 'update_subtask' for subtasks.

from.description: Task ID from which to start updating (inclusive). IMPORTANT: This tool uses 'from', not 'id'

prompt.description: Explanation of changes or new context to apply

research.description: Use Perplexity AI for research-backed updates

file.description: Path to the tasks file relative to project root

projectRoot.description: The directory of the project. (Optional, usually from session)

name: update_task
description: Updates a single task by ID with new information or context provided in the prompt.

id.description: ID of the task (e.g., '15') to update. Subtasks are supported using the update-subtask tool.

prompt.description: New information or context to incorporate into the task

research.description: Use Perplexity AI for research-backed updates

append.description: Append timestamped information to task details instead of full update

file.description: Absolute path to the tasks file

projectRoot.description: The directory of the project. Must be an absolute path.

name: update_subtask
description: Appends timestamped information to a specific subtask without replacing existing content. If you just want to update the subtask status, use set_task_status instead.

id.description: ID of the subtask to update in format "parentId.subtaskId" (e.g., "5.2"). Parent ID is the ID of the task that contains the subtask.

prompt.description: Information to add to the subtask

research.description: Use Perplexity AI for research-backed updates

file.description: Absolute path to the tasks file

projectRoot.description: The directory of the project. Must be an absolute path.

name: remove_task
description: Remove a task or subtask permanently from the tasks list

id.description: ID of the task or subtask to remove (e.g., '5' or '5.2'). Can be comma-separated to update multiple tasks/subtasks at once.

file.description: Absolute path to the tasks file

projectRoot.description: The directory of the project. Must be an absolute path.

confirm.description: Whether to skip confirmation prompt (default: false)

tag.description: Specify which tag context to operate on. Defaults to the current active tag.

name: remove_subtask
description: Remove a subtask from its parent task

convert.description: Convert the subtask to a standalone task instead of deleting it

projectRoot.description: The directory of the project. Must be an absolute path.

from.description: ID of the task/subtask to move (e.g., "5" or "5.2"). Can be comma-separated to move multiple tasks (e.g., "5,6,7")
